intro: Psychotria subcoriacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental or medicinal value. Psychotria subcoriacea is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in these ecosystems.
